snippet: The Army sent 1.3 million troops to war after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, creating the most combat-tested force in the nation’s history. But now it must sustain morale on its bases.
abstract: Most of two million American men and women who fought in Afghanistan and Iraq wars have returned home to new lives full of uncertainty; sustaining morale and purpose for those still in active service presents particular challenge for Army.
lead_paragraph: The Army sent 1.3 million troops to war after the Sept. 11, 2001, attacks, creating the most combat-tested force in the nation’s history. But now it must sustain morale on its bases.

headline.main: After Years at War, the Army Adapts to Garrison Life
headline.print_headline: After Years at War, the Army Adapts to Garrison Life

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
